meanings.definition: The act of moving an aircraft on the ground under its own power.
meanings.sent1: The taxiing of the plane was smooth and steady.
meanings.sent2: The airport crew guided the taxiing aircraft to the runway.
meanings.sent3: The taxiing plane seemed to dance gracefully on the tarmac.
meanings.sent4: The taxiing aircraft resembled a giant bird gliding on the runway.
meanings.sent5: The loud roar of the engines filled the air as the plane began taxiing.

meanings.definition: The act of moving a vehicle slowly on the ground, especially in preparation for takeoff or after landing.
meanings.sent1: After landing, the taxiing of the car to the parking spot was uneventful.
meanings.sent2: The taxiing of the bus towards the terminal was carefully monitored by the driver.
meanings.sent3: The taxiing truck looked like a snail making its way across the road.
meanings.sent4: The taxiing vehicle inched forward like a cautious turtle on the pavement.
meanings.sent5: The smooth taxiing of the boat along the dock impressed the onlookers.
